definition: unfettered and beyond the law (idiom); evading retribution/getting away with it (e.g. crimes)/still at large
France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])

sentences.english: Nor is there any question that al-Qaeda is at large in Diyala.
sentences.chinese: 基地组织在迪亚拉逍遥法外也是毫无疑问的。

sentences.english: Hundreds of those convicts remain at large.
sentences.chinese: 数以百计的逃犯仍逍遥法外。

sentences.english: The  escaped prisoner is still at large.
Can LuoShanShan will kill murderer at large?
sentences.chinese: 能将杀死罗珊珊的凶手逍遥法外吗？

sentences.english: They got off scot-free because of lack of evidence.
sentences.chinese: 由于证据不足，他们得以逍遥法外。

sentences.english: Megarton and his forces remain at large.
sentences.chinese: 威震天和他的部队仍然逍遥法外。

sentences.english: The escaped prisoner remained at large for weeks.
sentences.chinese: 逃犯一直逍遥法外达数周之久。

sentences.english: Both escapees are still at large.
sentences.chinese: 目前这两名逃犯仍然逍遥法外。

sentences.english: Never allow a sinful act to go unpunished.
sentences.chinese: 决不允许罪恶的行为逍遥法外。

sentences.english: They can basically ride off into the sunset scot-free.
sentences.chinese: 他们基本上可以趁着日落开溜，逍遥法外。

sentences.english: The fugitive concealed himself from his pursuers.
sentences.chinese: 那个逃犯还在逍遥法外。

sentences.english: Violent attacks against journalists are going unpunished in many of the countries.
sentences.chinese: 在很多国家，对记者实施暴力攻击者逍遥法外。

sentences.english: The thieves must not go unpunished.
sentences.chinese: 决不能让这些盗贼逍遥法外。

sentences.english: It would surely be wrong to let them go scot-free just for lack of finger-prints.
sentences.chinese: 由于缺少指纹而使他逍遥法外是肯定错误的。

definition: to punish according to the law/to bring to justice
to break the law and commit crimes (idiom); malefactor/evildoer/to perpetrate outrages
to commit a crime or offence
